Historian, educator, and author. Chiefly transcripts of manuscripts in various repositories in England. The material relates to admiralty courts and cases as well as trade and political matters.

titlestmt.titleproper: Charles McLean Andrews Collection Concerning Colonial History
titlestmt.subtitle: A Finding Aid to the Collection in the Library of Congress
titlestmt.author: Prepared by Manuscript Division Staff

profiledesc.creation:
Finding aid encoded by Library of Congress Manuscript Division,
2009

did.head: Collection Summary
did.unittitle: Charles McLean Andrews Collection Concerning Colonial History 1623-1800
did.abstract: Historian, educator, and author. Chiefly transcripts of manuscripts in various repositories in England. The material relates to admiralty courts and cases as well as trade and political matters.

note.p: The following terms have been used to index the description of this collection in the Library's online catalog. They are grouped by name of person or organization, by subject or location, and by occupation and listed alphabetically therein.

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The Charles McLean Andrews Collection Concerning Colonial History was given to the Library of Congress by Evangeline Walker Andrews in 1944.

processinfo.head: Processing History
processinfo.p: The papers of Charles McLean Andrews were arranged and described in 1944. The finding aid was revised in 2009.

otherfindaid.head: Additional Guides
otherfindaid.p: Card indexes of the Andrews Collection are available in the Manuscript Division Reading Room. Consult the reference staff for additional information.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: The Andrews Collection complements the Manuscript Division's foreign copying collection of manuscripts and records relating to American history in British archives.

userestrict.head: Copyright Status
userestrict.p: It is the researcher's responsibility to determine requirements of domestic copyright laws and international treaties and conventions.

accessrestrict.head: Access and Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: The papers of Charles McLean Andrews are open to research. Researchers are advised to contact the Manuscript Reading Room prior to visiting. Many collections are stored off-site and advance notice is needed to retrieve these items for research use.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Researchers wishing to cite this collection should include the following information: Container number, Charles McLean Andrews Collection Concerning Colonial History, Manuscript Division, Library of Congress, Washington, D.C.

chronitem.event: Ph.D., Johns Hopkins University, Baltimore, Md.
Professor, Bryn Mawr College, Hartford, Conn.
Published Colonial Self-Government, 1652-1689. New York, London: Harper & Brothers
Professor, Johns Hopkins University, Baltimore, Md.
Published Guide to the Manuscript Materials for the History of the United States to 1783 in the British Museum and Other Depositories. Washington, D.C.: Carnegie Institution of Washington
Professor, American History, Yale University, New Haven, Conn.
Published The Colonial Background of the American Revolution. Haven: Yale University Press
President, American Historical Association, Washington, D.C.
Pulitzer Prize in history, The Colonial Period of American History. New Haven: Yale University Press; London: Oxford University Press
Awarded gold medal for history and biography, National Institute of Arts and Letters, New York, N.Y.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The Charles McLean Andrews Collection Concerning Colonial History consists of transcripts of manuscripts in various repositories in England and spans the years 1623-1800. The materials were accumulated by Andrews for use in his writings on American colonial history and cover admiralty courts and cases, trade, and political matters. Andrews authored Lists of Transcript from the British Museum and the Bodleian Library . . . (Washington, D.C.: Carnegie Institution of Washington, 1908) that lists the transcripts acquired by the Library of Congress.

arrangement.head: Arrangement of the Papers
arrangement.p: This collection is arranged by source of material.
